text: Seeing one's logic crumple to dust and realising one is surrounded by ignoramuses is enough to cause even the greatest of scholars to fall off his horse in mental anguish.
Jade that is unpolished shall never be useful.
Live until you are old, and study until you are old.
Even when atop the peaks of brilliance, one must realise that there are no limits to what can be learned and accomplished.
[[b]]Erudition[[/b]] can be increased by low level characters and assignments.
[[b]]Erudition[[/b]] can be decreased by high level characters and assignments.
By embracing the knowledge of the ancients, and through the sharing of new ideas, the state itself can become an academy of learning - to the benefit of all.
• Boost experience gain and starting rank of new generals and units
• Loss by high rank characters and assignments
• Gain by low rank characters and assignments
By embracing the knowledge of the ancients, and through the sharing of new ideas, the state itself can become an academy of learning - to the benefit of all.
By embracing the knowledge of the ancients, and through the sharing of new ideas, the state itself can become an academy of learning - to the benefit of all.

In order to find new perspectives on ancient wisdom, and to apply it to the modern world, your officer shall host open, friendly debates among the local scholars. That way, eyes and minds may be opened to new avenues of thinking.
Knowledge must be freely shared in order to be useful. Your adjutant shall offer their wisdom to the people of the region.
